The accidental release prevention and emergency response policies:



Accra-Pac, Inc. DBA Voyant Beauty is committed to promoting a safe operating environment for the facility, its

employees and the surrounding community. The Distribution Center has completed the development and

implementation of its OSHA's Process Safety Management (PSM) program, and its EPA's Risk Management

prevention program. Compliance with these regulations helps to ensure that the covered process (warehouse

operation involving packaged products containing flammable substances) is designed, operated and maintained

safely.



Accra-Pac, Inc. DBA Voyant Beauty recognizes that environmental, health and safety (E.H.S.) compliance is a key

business output with significant impact on corporate performance and success. It is Accra-Pac, Inc. DBA Voyant Beauty

Products policy to conduct its operations in a responsible manner with sustained good faith efforts to maintain

compliance with all Federal, State and Local regulations, including those of the Environmental Protection

Agency (EPA), the Occupational Safety & Health Administration (OSHA), the Indiana Department of

Environmental Management (IDEM), the Elkhart County Health Department, and the City of Elkhart Public

Works.



We pledge to be a responsible corporate citizen and to manage company operations to protect human health,

natural resources and the environment. Our goal is to minimize recognized environmental, health and safety

hazards at our facilities. We will implement procedures to help accomplish this goal, and to help any injured or

ill employee obtain quality medical care, modified duties in a productive capacity for recuperating employees,

and a rapid return to work where possible.



Safety, health and environmental protection are an integral part of our daily business. Management and

supervision are accountable for ensuring employees are trained to perform work safely and in an

environmentally responsible manner, for

abating safety and health hazards, for minimizing discharges to the

environment, and for conserving natural resources through material reuse and waste reduction practices.

Employees are expected to conduct their daily tasks in a manner consistent with the E.H.S. Policy, to comply

with company procedures, and to support all compliance efforts. Environmental, health and safety compliance is a responsibility that must be shared equally and without exception by each individual within the organization.



Facility and the regulated substances handled:



The Distribution Center is located at 2700 Middlebury Street, Elkhart, Indiana. The Distribution Center is

adjacent to the Accra-Pac, Inc. DBA Voyant Beauty Main and North Plants that house nine aerosol manufacturing

lines and one liquid filling line, as well as compounding facilities and storage facilities for raw materials.



The Distribution Center occupies 210,000 square feet under roof. It has been designed and constructed in

accordance with the current building codes and fire standards, and includes features such as a fire protection

sprinkler system supported by a pump house, and fire detection and alarms systems that are constantly

monitored and maintained by a contracted security company.



The Distribution Center provides storage of incoming components and outgoing finished products for the Main

and North Plants. The incoming components include metal cans, plastic valves and caps, and corrugated

boxes. The outgoing finished products are consumer commodities for various sectors including personal care,

household, food and pharmaceutical. The finished products include air fresheners, hair mousses and sprays,

body sprays, cooking sprays, cleaning products, liquid soaps, shaving creams, and foot sprays. Many of these

products are aerosols and contain flammable propellants. The regulated chemicals used as propellants that

may be present are:



n-Butane (CAS No. 106-97-8)

Difluoroethane (CAS No. 75-

37-6)

Dimethyl Ether (Methyl ether) (CAS No. 115-10-6)

Isobutane (CAS No. 75-28-5)

Propane (CAS No. 74-98-6)



The contents of the Distribution Center will vary as production requirements dictate. The Risk Management

Plan has been prepared to include predictive filing, as the flammable propellant content of the packaged

goods in storage may vary from 0 pounds to over 1,000,000 pounds.



General accidental release prevention program and chemical-specific prevention steps:



The Distribution Center has been designed in accordance with the National Fire Protection Association (NFPA)

30-B, Code for the Manufacture and Storage of Aerosol Products, the purpose of which is to provide

requirements for the prevention and control of fires and explosions in facilities that manufacture, store, or

display aerosol products. The Distribution Center has also been included in the Process Safety Management

program developed and implemented at the adjacent Accra-Pac, Inc. DBA Voyant Beauty North and Main Plants.

The PSM program has been incorporated as both policy, and most importantly, procedure in everyday

operations and maintenance of the Distribution Center.



Five-year accident history:



There have been no incidents in the past 5 years.



Emergency response program:



The Distribution Center has been included in the "Integrated Contingency Plan" and that also

addresses the adjacent Main and North Plants. This plan has been coordinated with the Elkhart Fire

Department and Elkhart County Local Emergency Planning Committee, as well as the Indiana Emergency

Planning Committee. The plan addresses fire, explosion, spills and releases of chemicals, severe weather, and

other criteria. The plan details actions to be taken for such emergencies, safety equipment, communication

responsibilities, and coordination with off-site responders. The emergency response program is based on the

OSHA requirements for Emergency Action Plans (29 CFR 1910.38 and 1910.119), Emergenc

y Response Plan

(40 CFR Part 68.265.50) and HAZWOPER (29 CFR 1910.120). Our employees and emergency coordinators

are trained on this emergency procedures plan. The written plan is maintained on-site at key locations and has

been shared with outside responders, including our contracted spill response company.



Planned changes to improve safety:



The Distribution Center was constructed to comply with all current safety and fire protection requirements and

will continually work to improve safety in all areas. The facility encourages input from operation and

maintenance personnel, as well as vendor and agency inspectors, and responds to address potential

improvements. The facility places a high emphasis upon training of personnel and maintaining safe operations

that comply with all environmental requirements.
